summary: Update "get", "set" and trailing comma parse errors to reference EcmaScript5 options

comments.content:
selection of esmascript standart using --language is good. but there are no user-readable warning if you cannot minify your script - thats why this is hackwork or moonlighting or trash (I dont know the english word for russian "халтура")

if the was an erorrs (for example JSC_PARSE_ERROR) during minifying your script - warning whould appear:
Your script can't be minified using ${CURRENT_ESMA} standarts. try to select another esma standart using --language_in option

You should implement selection of esma standart in webservice page too

yes this is readable error no comments (без базара). but you know that limited enum of types of exceptions can be trown in esmascript standart 5 if you compile using esmascript standart 3

what I see know:
JSC_PARSE_ERROR...
JSC_PARSE_ERROR...
JSC_PARSE_ERROR...
...

what i want to see:
JSC_PARSE_ERROR...
JSC_PARSE_ERROR...
JSC_PARSE_ERROR...
...
Your script can't be minified using esmascript 3 standarts. try to select another esmascript standart using --language_in option

how to implement this in general:
boolean esmascript_mismatch = false;
..
catch(exception &e) {
  esmascript_mismatch ||= e.esmascript_mismatch
  ...
}
if(esmascript_mismatch)
  cerr << "Your script can't be minified using esmascript 3 standarts. try to select another esmascript standart using --language_in option"
you should make your utilites more human-readable because over 9000 programmers use it. thank you for your understanding

The general concern is this:
1) Joe writes code and tests only on browser X
2) Joe compiles code, see warning "use --language_in=ES5"
3) Joe uses --language_in=ES5
4) Joe is confused why people are complaining that their code doesn't run on IE8,7,6 (fails with parse errors).

Perhaps we could simply say:
"getters are not part of EcmaScript3. If you are targeting EcmaScript 5, set the appropriate language option"
yes. but not only getters and setters. you should investigate which exceptions can be thrown in the case of esmascript mismatch
This issue was closed by revision r1925.
